Dataset (Source/Database Name): GlobalData analysis based on information from Central Bank of Egypt
Definition: Data refers to budget surplus or deficit as percent of GDP. The indicator is calculated as the difference between total revenue and total expenditure, including capital expenditure (in particular, gross fixed capital formation). A positive figure indicates a surplus and a negative figure indicates a deficit
Indicators: Public sector finances: budget surplus/deficit (% of GDP)
Methodology Notes: Forecast data has been derived using the trends of General government net lending/borrowing and Nominal GDP USD. Historical data has been directly sourced from NSOs.
